Much like Superman IV, this film has good intentions but doesn't get to do them right. The characters are barely developed, so we can't be attached to them and what they feel, the story is pretty much uni-dimensional and the message it tries to tell is obscured by these facts. Sadly, this movie is based on a real case of cancer disease, and it doens't accomplish the message? That's unforgivable.

The true story from which this film is inspired must be heartwarming but all emotions are lost in this adaptation for Letters to God only have wooden acting, characters whose lines were delivered without conviction, and a script that must be written by a grade school student.
